query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 O insensata cura de’ mortali, 2 quanto son difettivi silogismi 3 quei che ti fanno in basso batter l’ali!
query.error: **English:** 1 O senseless eagerness of mortals, 2 how defective are the syllogisms 3 that make you beat your wings downward!
query.result: 1 O unwisdom of mortal cares, 2 how faulty are the reasonings 3 that make you beat your wings downward!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 Chi dietro a iura e chi ad amforismi 5 sen giva, e chi seguendo sacerdozio, 6 e chi regnar per forza o per sofismi,
query.error: **English:** 4 One goes after laws and another after medical aphorisms, 5 and one, following the priesthood, 6 and one, by force or by sophistry, to reign,
query.result: 4 One goes after laws and another after medical aphorisms, 5 and one, following the priesthood, 6 and one, by force or by sophistry, to reign,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 e chi rubare e chi civil negozio, 8 chi nel diletto de la carne involto 9 s’affaticava e chi si dava a l’ozio,
query.error: **English:** 7 and one to thieve and one to civil business, 8 one toils in the delight of the flesh 9 and one gives himself up to idleness,
query.result: 7 and one to thieve and one to civil business, 8 one toils in the delight of the flesh 9 and one gives himself up to idleness,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 quando, da tutte queste cose sciolto, 11 con Bëatrice m’era suso in cielo 12 cotanto glorïosamente accolto.
query.error: **English:** 10 when, loosed from all these things, 11 with Beatrice I was welcomed up into heaven 12 so gloriously.
query.result: 10 when, loosed from all these things, 11 with Beatrice I was welcomed up into heaven 12 so gloriously.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 Poi che ciascuno fu tornato ne lo 14 punto del cerchio in che avanti s’era, 15 fermossi, come a candellier candelo.
query.error: **English:** 13 After each one had returned to the 14 point of the circle where he had been before, 15 he stood still, like a candle in a candlestick.
query.result: 13 Þa wæs æghwylc eft cumen to ðam 14 stede ðæs hweorfes ðær he ær wæs, 15 and ðær stod, swa candel on candelstæf.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 E io senti’ dentro a quella lumera 17 che pria m’avea parlato, sorridendo 18 incominciar, faccendosi più mera:
query.error: **English:** 16 And I heard within that light 17 which had spoken to me before, smiling 18 begin, becoming brighter:
query.result: 16 And ic ða gehyrde on ðære leohte 17 ðe ær wið me spræc, ða ða heo smilende 18 ongan ðus sprecan, ða heo wæs geworden beorhtra:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 «Così com’ io del suo raggio resplendo, 20 sì, riguardando ne la luce etterna, 21 li tuoi pensieri onde cagioni apprendo.
query.error: **English:** 19 "Just as I shine with its radiance, 20 so, looking into the eternal light, 21 I learn the thoughts from which you draw conclusions.
query.result: 19 "Swa swa ic of hire leoman leohte, 20 swa on ðære ecan leohte ðine ðancas, 21 ðe ðu on ðinum mode gemetest, ic ða oncnawe."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 Tu dubbi, e hai voler che si ricerna 23 in sì aperta e ’n sì distesa lingua 24 lo dicer mio, ch’al tuo sentir si sterna,
query.error: **English:** 22 You doubt, and you want my speech to be explained 23 in such clear and explicit language 24 that it may conform to your understanding,
query.result: 22 ðu tweost, and ðu woldest ðæt man gerecðe 23 on swylce openlicre and on swylce awritenre spræce 24 ðone min word, ðæt he ðinum andgite gelic ðurh ðæt,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 ove dinanzi dissi: “U’ ben s’impingua”, 26 e là u’ dissi: “Non nacque il secondo”; 27 e qui è uopo che ben si distingua.
query.error: **English:** 25 where I said earlier: “Where one fattens well”, 26 and where I said: “His like was never born”; 27 and here it is necessary to make a fine distinction.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 La provedenza, che governa il mondo 29 con quel consiglio nel quale ogne aspetto 30 creato è vinto pria che vada al fondo,
query.error: **English:** 28 Providence, which governs the world 29 with that counsel in which every created thing 30 is overcome before it comes to an end,
query.result: 28 Þæt foresceawung ðe wealdað þone weorold 29 mid þæm ræde þe ælc gesceaft 30 bið oferwunnen ær hit weorðe to wuhte,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 però che andasse ver’ lo suo diletto 32 la sposa di colui ch’ad alte grida 33 disposò lei col sangue benedetto,
query.error: **English:** 31 so that the bride of him who with loud cries 32 betrothed her with his blessed blood 33 might go towards her beloved,
query.result: 31 forðæm þe seo bryd þæs þe mid hlude stefne 32 hire beweddade mid his bletsodan blode, 33 to hire leofestan lustum wendan sceolde,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 in sé sicura e anche a lui più fida, 35 due principi ordinò in suo favore, 36 che quinci e quindi le fosser per guida.
query.error: **English:** 34 secure in herself and even more faithful to him, 35 ordained two princes in her favor, 36 who on this side and that should be her guides.
query.result: 34 on hire sylfre trywe and eac him getreowre, 35 twegen ealdras hire on fultume gesceop, 36 þe hire on ægðre healfe wæron to lareowum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 L’un fu tutto serafico in ardore; 38 l’altro per sapïenza in terra fue 39 di cherubica luce uno splendore.
query.error: **English:** 37 One was all seraphic in ardor; 38 the other, for wisdom on earth, was 39 a splendor of cherubic light.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 De l’un dirò, però che d’amendue 41 si dice l’un pregiando, qual ch’om prende, 42 perch’ ad un fine fur l’opere sue.
query.error: **English:** 40 Of one I will speak, because of both 41 one is praised, whichever one you take, 42 because his works had one end.
query.result: 40 Ic secge be ðæm anum, forðæm ðe be ðæm oðrum 41 is gesæd ðæt an herigende, hwæðer ðe ðu nime, 42 forðæm ðe his weorc wæs to anum ende.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 Intra Tupino e l’acqua che discende 44 del colle eletto dal beato Ubaldo, 45 fertile costa d’alto monte pende,
query.error: **English:** 43 Between Tupino and the stream that descends 44 from the hill chosen by the blessed Ubaldo, 45 a fertile slope of a high mountain hangs,
query.result: 43 Betwux Tupino and ðære ea ðe ofstigð 44 of ðam beorgge ðe se halga Ubald geceas, 45 wlitig wuduhæð of heanre dune hangað,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 onde Perugia sente freddo e caldo 47 da Porta Sole; e di rietro le piange 48 per grave giogo Nocera con Gualdo.
query.error: **English:** 46 from which Perugia feels the cold and heat 47 from Porta Sole; and behind it weeps 48 Nocera with Gualdo, because of the heavy yoke.
query.result: 46 ðanon Peruse feleð ceald and hætu 47 of Sunnan Geate; and ðæræfter wepeð 48 Nocera mid Wealdende, for ðam hefigan gioce.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Di questa costa, là dov’ ella frange 50 più sua rattezza, nacque al mondo un sole, 51 come fa questo talvolta di Gange.
query.error: **English:** 49 On this coast, where it breaks 50 its greatest force, a sun was born into the world, 51 as sometimes happens on the Ganges.
query.result: 49 On ðære sæcce, ðær heo ðone ræst gebrecð, 50 mæste mereflōd, þær monna cyn 51 on ðam Garsecge gearo gesawon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 Però chi d’esso loco fa parole, 53 non dica Ascesi, ché direbbe corto, 54 ma Orïente, se proprio dir vuole.
query.error: **English:** 52 Therefore, whoever speaks of that place, 53 should not say Ascesi, for that would be too short, 54 but Oriente, if he wants to say it properly.
query.result: 52 Forðæm se ðe ðæs stowes wordum mæleð, 53 ne secge Ascesi, forðæm hit sceort wäre, 54 ac Orientes, gif he rihte secgan wile.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 Non era ancor molto lontan da l’orto, 56 ch’el cominciò a far sentir la terra 57 de la sua gran virtute alcun conforto;
query.error: **English:** 55 It was not yet very far from the east, 56 when he began to make the earth 57 feel some comfort from his great power;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 ché per tal donna, giovinetto, in guerra 59 del padre corse, a cui, come a la morte, 60 la porta del piacer nessun diserra;
query.error: **English:** 58 for such a lady, as a youth, in war 59 he had run from his father, to whom, as to death, 60 no one unlocks the door of pleasure;
query.result: 58 for ðære ðryðe, ða ða he geong wæs, 59 on weres wæstmum wig forð gesohte, 60 ðam ðe nænig mon, swa ðam deade,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 e dinanzi a la sua spirital corte 62 et coram patre le si fece unito; 63 poscia di dì in dì l’amò più forte.
query.error: **English:** 61 and before his spiritual court 62 and coram patre he united himself to her; 63 then day by day he loved her more strongly.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 Questa, privata del primo marito, 65 millecent’ anni e più dispetta e scura 66 fino a costui si stette sanza invito;
query.error: **English:** 64 This one, deprived of her first husband, 65 a thousand years and more, scorned and obscure, 66 remained until this man without a suitor;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 né valse udir che la trovò sicura 68 con Amiclate, al suon de la sua voce, 69 colui ch’a tutto ’l mondo fé paura;
query.error: **English:** 67 nor did it avail her to hear that he found her secure 68 with Amiclates, at the sound of his voice, 69 he who made the whole world tremble;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 né valse esser costante né feroce, 71 sì che, dove Maria rimase giuso, 72 ella con Cristo pianse in su la croce.
query.error: **English:** 70 nor did it avail her to be steadfast and fierce, 71 so that, where Mary remained below, 72 she with Christ wept upon the cross.
query.result: 70 ne mihte ða geðolian ðæt he ðurh ðone dolg wære, 71 swa ðæt Maria wæs on ðam meðelstade, 72 ac heo mid Criste on rode weop.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 Ma perch’ io non proceda troppo chiuso, 74 Francesco e Povertà per questi amanti 75 prendi oramai nel mio parlar diffuso.
query.error: **English:** 73 But so that I may not proceed too obscurely, 74 take now in my diffuse speech Francis and Poverty as these lovers.
query.result: 73 Ac ðæt ic ne fare to ðigelumlicor, 74 nim nu on minum wordum ða widsædon 75 ðæt synd Franciscus and Armod.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 La lor concordia e i lor lieti sembianti, 77 amore e maraviglia e dolce sguardo 78 facieno esser cagion di pensier santi;
query.error: **English:** 76 Their harmony and their joyful expressions, 77 love and wonder and sweet gazes 78 made them a cause of holy thoughts;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 tanto che ’l venerabile Bernardo 80 si scalzò prima, e dietro a tanta pace 81 corse e, correndo, li parve esser tardo.
query.error: **English:** 79 so much so that the venerable Bernard 80 took off his shoes first, and after such peace 81 ran, and running, seemed to himself to be slow.
query.result: 79 swa ðæt se arwurða Bernardus 80 ærst his sceos offeorpode, and æfter ðære sibbe 81 arn, and him ðuhte ðæt he arn to slawlice.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 Oh ignota ricchezza! oh ben ferace! 83 Scalzasi Egidio, scalzasi Silvestro 84 dietro a lo sposo, sì la sposa piace.
query.error: **English:** 82 Oh unknown riches! Oh fertile good! 83 Egidius goes barefoot, Sylvester goes barefoot 84 behind the Bridegroom, so the Bride pleases.
query.result: 82 Eala uncuðe sped! Eala wel þungende! 83 Gæð Egidius barfot, gæð Silvester barfot 84 æfter ðam brydguman, swa ðære bryde licað.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 Indi sen va quel padre e quel maestro 86 con la sua donna e con quella famiglia 87 che già legava l’umile capestro.
query.error: **English:** 85 Then goes that father and that teacher 86 with his lady and with that family 87 that already bound the humble cord.
query.result: 85 Þa gæð se fæder and se lareow 86 mid his wife and mid ðære mægðe 87 ðe ða eadmodan reaf gefetedon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 Né li gravò viltà di cuor le ciglia 89 per esser fi’ di Pietro Bernardone, 90 né per parer dispetto a maraviglia;
query.error: **English:** 88 Nor did the humility of his heart weigh down his brow, 89 for being the son of Pietro Bernardone, 90 nor for seeming wondrously despised;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 ma regalmente sua dura intenzione 92 ad Innocenzio aperse, e da lui ebbe 93 primo sigillo a sua religïone.
query.error: **English:** 91 but he royally revealed his steadfast intention 92 to Innocent, and from him he received 93 the first seal of his religious order.
query.result: 91 ac he cynelice his heardan willan 92 Innocentio æteowde, and of him feng 93 ærest ðære regule his rihtes insegle.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 Poi che la gente poverella crebbe 95 dietro a costui, la cui mirabil vita 96 meglio in gloria del ciel si canterebbe,
query.error: **English:** 94 After the humble folk increased 95 behind him, whose wondrous life 96 would be better sung in the glory of heaven,
query.result: 94 Þa ða ðæt earme folc geweox 95 æfter ðam, ðæs wuldorfulle lif 96 betere in heofona rice rædan meahte,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 di seconda corona redimita 98 fu per Onorio da l’Etterno Spiro 99 la santa voglia d’esto archimandrita.
query.error: **English:** 97 with a second crown was crowned 98 by Honorius, by the Eternal Spirit, 99 the holy desire of this archimandrite.
query.result: 97 mid æfteran wuldorgestealde 98 wearð geglencged fram Honorio ðurh ðæs Ecan Gastes 99 ðæs halgan willan ðæs ealdormannes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 E poi che, per la sete del martiro, 101 ne la presenza del Soldan superba 102 predicò Cristo e li altri che ’l seguiro,
query.error: **English:** 100 And then, because of his thirst for martyrdom, 101 in the presence of the proud Sultan 102 he preached Christ and the others who followed him,
query.result: 100 And ða ða, ðurh ða ðurst ðæs martyrdomes, 101 on ðære gesyhðe ðæs Soldanes ofermodigan 102 he bodode Crist and ða oðre ðe him fyligdon,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 e per trovare a conversione acerba 104 troppo la gente e per non stare indarno, 105 redissi al frutto de l’italica erba,
query.error: **English:** 103 and because he found the people too obstinate to convert 104 and because he did not want to stay there in vain, 105 he returned to the fruit of the Italian land,
query.result: 103 and forðæm ðe he ðæt folc funde to stiðe 104 to gecyrrenne and forðæm ðe he nolde ðær wunian on idel, 105 he gewende eft to ðære wæstme ðære italican wyrte,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 nel crudo sasso intra Tevero e Arno 107 da Cristo prese l’ultimo sigillo, 108 che le sue membra due anni portarno.
query.error: **English:** 106 in the harsh rock between the Tiber and the Arno 107 he received from Christ the final seal, 108 which his body bore for two years.
query.result: 106 on ðæm heardan stane betwux Tybre and Erne 107 he onfeng æt Criste ðone æftemestan insegl, 108 ðone his limu twegen gear bæron.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 Quando a colui ch’a tanto ben sortillo 110 piacque di trarlo suso a la mercede 111 ch’el meritò nel suo farsi pusillo,
query.error: **English:** 109 When it pleased him who had chosen him for such great good 110 to draw him up to the mercy 111 that he had earned by becoming humble,
query.result: 109 Þa wæs ðam leofran, ðe hine to ðam micclan gode geceas, 110 willan ðæt he hine up ateah to ðære mildheortnesse, 111 ðe he mid his eaðmodnesse begeat,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 a’ frati suoi, sì com’ a giuste rede, 113 raccomandò la donna sua più cara, 114 e comandò che l’amassero a fede;
query.error: **English:** 112 to his brothers, as to just heirs, 113 he commended his dearest lady, 114 and commanded that they should love her faithfully;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 e del suo grembo l’anima preclara 116 mover si volle, tornando al suo regno, 117 e al suo corpo non volle altra bara.
query.error: **English:** 115 and from his lap his glorious soul 116 wished to depart, returning to its kingdom, 117 and for his body he wanted no other bier.
query.result: 115 and of his bearm his beorhta gast 116 wolde gewitan, wendan to his rice, 117 and his lice ne wolde nænigne oðerne byrst.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Pensa oramai qual fu colui che degno 119 collega fu a mantener la barca 120 di Pietro in alto mar per dritto segno;
query.error: **English:** 118 Now think who he was, who was worthy 119 to be a colleague in keeping the bark 120 of Peter on the high seas by the right sign;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 e questo fu il nostro patrïarca; 122 per che qual segue lui, com’ el comanda, 123 discerner puoi che buone merce carca.
query.error: **English:** 121 and this was our patriarch; 122 therefore whoever follows him, as he commands, 123 you can discern that he carries good merchandise.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 Ma ’l suo pecuglio di nova vivanda 125 è fatto ghiotto, sì ch’esser non puote 126 che per diversi salti non si spanda;
query.error: **English:** 124 But his flock, with new food, 125 has become greedy, so that it cannot be 126 that it does not scatter through various paths;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 e quanto le sue pecore remote 128 e vagabunde più da esso vanno, 129 più tornano a l’ovil di latte vòte.
query.error: **English:** 127 and as much as his sheep, far-off 128 and wandering, go farther from it, 129 the more they return to the fold empty of milk.
query.result: 127 and swa fela swa his sceapa feorran 128 and wídlástre fram him síðiað, 129 swa ðý má his eowudu beoð æmtige.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 Ben son di quelle che temono ’l danno 131 e stringonsi al pastor; ma son sì poche, 132 che le cappe fornisce poco panno.
query.error: **English:** 130 I am indeed one of those who fear harm 131 and huddle close to the shepherd; but we are so few, 132 that our cloaks provide scant cloth.
query.result: 130 Ic eom to soðan ðara ðe ðone sceaðan ondrædað, 131 and to ðam hyrde holdlice hlimmað; ac we synd swa feawe, 132 ðæt ure cæpan lytle clæðas forðbringað.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 Or, se le mie parole non son fioche, 134 se la tua audïenza è stata attenta, 135 se ciò ch’è detto a la mente revoche,
query.error: **English:** 133 Now, if my words are not hollow, 134 if your listening has been attentive, 135 if what has been said comes back to your mind,
query.result: 133 Nu, gif mine word ne sint dwollice, 134 gif ðin hlyste wæs geornlice, 135 gif ðæt ðe is gesæd ðin mód geðenceð,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 in parte fia la tua voglia contenta, 137 perché vedrai la pianta onde si scheggia, 138 e vedra’ il corrègger che argomenta
query.error: **English:** 136 your desire will be partly satisfied, 137 because you will see the plant from which it splinters, 138 and you will see the correction that argues
query.result: 136 on dæl bið ðin willa gefyrhted, 137 forðæm ðe ðu gesihst ðone telgan ðanon he sceal sceacan, 138 and ðu gesihst ða gerihta ðe ðær wid sprecað

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
139 “U’ ben s’impingua, se non si vaneggia”».
query.error: **English:** 139 “Where one grows fat, if one does not go astray”».
query.result: 139 “Ðær man weleð, gif he ne dolgað”».
